newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australian Stocks to Watch Today - May 5.
newsitem.headline: Australian Stocks to Watch Today - May 5.

text.p: Some Australian stocks to watch this morning:

Australian billionaire Kerry Packer's Publishing and Broadcasting Ltd (PBL) confirmed on Saturday that it would not proceed with a A$240 million deal to buy the management contract for the Sydney Harbour Casino. Packer's move is seen freeing him up for a takeover or merger bid for John Fairfax Holdings Ltd. The government is expected to consider easing cross-media rules at a cabinet meeting on Tuesday, which would allow Packer to bid for Fairfax.
* Broken Hill Pty Co Ltd A$18.04 (-0.04)
BHP unions meet with the Australian Council of Trade Unions (ACTU) in Sydney at 12.30 p.m. to decide whether to launch a nationwide one day strike at BHP sites on Wednesday.

Yet another blow was dealt Friday to the pending direct-TV satellite deal between EchoStar Communications Corp and News Corp Ltd with the resignation of one of the venture's top executives. Preston Padden, the head of News Corp's ASkyB satellite TV service who was involved in negotiations with EchoStar, submitted his resignation, News Corp said, casting further doubt on plans to launch the venture.

The New South Wales state government said on Friday that it would sell the Axiom funds management business to Deutsche Bank Group for A$240 million, thwarting National Australia Bank which was thought to be the favoured bidder.

Pasminco Ltd said on Friday that production from its Elura base metals mine in New South Wales would stop for up to four weeks while pillar damage was repaired. Pasminco said on April 30 that it had halted production at the mine following pillar damage caused by blasting. It said then that assessment of the damage would take about two days.
Gold explorer Sipa International Resources Ltd said on Friday that it would incrase its offer for Arcadia Minerals Ltd to seven Sipa shares and 40 cents cash for every four Arcadia shares.
